meanings.definition: A bond or connection between individuals or groups.
meanings.sent1: The vinculums of friendship tie us together.
meanings.sent2: The vinculums of family are strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent3: The vinculums of teamwork make us a powerful force.
meanings.sent4: The vinculums of trust hold us close in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The vinculums of love can withstand any challenge.

meanings.definition: A physical or symbolic link that binds or unites.
meanings.sent1: The vinculums of a chain keep the gate closed.
meanings.sent2: The handshake was a vinculums of agreement between them.
meanings.sent3: The vinculums of a shared hobby brought them together.
meanings.sent4: The bridge served as a vinculums between the two towns.
meanings.sent5: The vinculums of a common goal united the team.

meanings.definition: A restraining device or mechanism used to secure or fasten objects together.
meanings.sent1: The handcuffs acted as vinculums, preventing escape.
meanings.sent2: The vinculums of the lock kept the treasure safe.
meanings.sent3: The vinculums of the seatbelt kept him secure in the car.
meanings.sent4: The vinculums of the net caught the falling objects.
meanings.sent5: The vinculums of the rope held the tent in place.
